key_findings: Relatives noted calming and sleep-improving effects; relatives were more aware of risks of discontinuing treatment; both groups complained about sedation and increased sleep need; diverging evaluations on hypersalivation, anticholinergic effects, and weight gain; relatives more concerned about long-term organ damage and haematotoxic effects; relatives showed slightly greater awareness of clozapine's advantages vs conventional neuroleptics

key_findings: Patients highlighted calming and relaxing effects and improved sleep as particularly positive; more than half expected worsening if they stopped medication; only every fifth feared relapse; fatigue and sedation were most often cited negative effects; absence of extrapyramidal side effects noted as advantage; only every tenth was aware of haemotopoietic system risks; many patients indifferent or had no opinion on blood tests
